pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:5.1: 27. The training rule on receiving respectfully
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood disrespectfully, as if wanting to throw it away. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:7.2: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:8.1: Almsfood is to be received respectfully.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect receives almsfood disrespectfully, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:10.1: The seventh training rule is finished.
